body_html:
There is a unit test for the c api in tensorflow/c/c_api_test.cc
make sure you can run that e.g.

$ bazel run tensorflow/c/c_api_test

Then you can try copying the contents of that into your file one by one until you achieve what you are trying to do.

In the reproduce instructions you could also just specify the git sha hash that you checked out from i.e.

git clone
git checkout
bazel build ...

P.S. when including large files, please use github's attach function (attach files by dragging and dropping in e.g. Chrome).

body:
There is a unit test for the c api in   tensorflow/c/c_api_test.cc
make sure you can run that e.g.

$ bazel run tensorflow/c/c_api_test

Then you can try copying the contents of that into your file one by one until you achieve what you are trying to do.  

In the reproduce instructions you could also just specify the git sha hash that you checked out from i.e.

git clone <tensorflow url>
git checkout <sha hash>
bazel build ...

P.S. when including large files, please use github's attach function (attach files by dragging and dropping in e.g. Chrome).
